required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: DOAC ADRs Retrospective Study on Genetic Variations
clinical_study.official_title: Investigation of Genetic Variations on Patients With Adverse Drug Events While on Direct Oral Anticoagulants (DOACs)

brief_summary.textblock: This retrospective study's objective is to evaluate if Cipherome's algorithm could have predicted the serious adverse drug reactions (ADRs) experienced by patients while on direct oral anti-coagulants (DOACs).

detailed_description.textblock: Using the latest next generation sequencing tools, this study will evaluate adverse drug reactions (ADRs) (e.g., major bleeding or treatment failure) in study participants while on direct oral anticoagulants (DOACs). A web-based program will analyze the data obtain from sequencing, and generate a drug safety score (DSS). The DSS risk score will be compared with pre-specified serious ADRs associated with DOAC therapy. A secondary analysis will involve discovery of novel variants that arise from our analysis and may potentially affect the outcome of DOAC treatment.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants with a Major Bleeding Event
primary_outcome.time_frame: Within 90 days of DOAC therapy initiation
primary_outcome.description: Reduction in hemoglobin of at least 2 g/dL Blood loss requiring transfusion of at least 2 units of whole blood or erythrocytes Critical anatomical sites of bleeding: intramuscular with compartment syndrome, intracranial, intraspinal, retroperitoneal, intraocular, pericardial, and atraumatic intra-articular bleeding. Bleeding led to death

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants with a Clinically Relevant Non-major Bleeding Event
primary_outcome.time_frame: Within 90 days of DOAC therapy initiation
primary_outcome.description: Acute or subacute clinically overt bleed that does not meet the criteria for a major bleed but prompts a clinical response, in that it leads to at least one of the following: A hospital admission for bleeding, or A physician guided medical or surgical treatment for bleeding, or A change in antithrombotic therapy (including interruption or discontinuation of study drug).

primary_outcome.time_frame: Through study completion, an average of 1 year

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants with a Thromboembolic Event
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Within 90 days of DOAC therapy initiation
secondary_outcome.description: Deep vein thrombosis, pulmonary embolism, ischemic stroke, transient ischemic attack, arterial thrombosis, or other thromboembolic event.

clinical_study.condition: Drug-Related Side Effects and Adverse Reactions

biospec_descr.textblock: Study participants will either submit saliva samples or have a laboratory drawn blood sample.

study_pop.textblock: All patients on rivaroxaban, apixaban, and dabigatran who experienced a serious adverse drug reaction and/or treatment failure.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Any adult patient 18 years and older, who experienced a serious adverse drug reaction while taking a DOAC and is able to provide informed consent.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Failure to provide informed consent
